Contradict fact: The claim that the photo shows King Minhti, an ancient King of Arakan in western Myanmar contradicts the fact that the photo is actually of Maharaja of Bundi, Maharao Raja Shri Sir Raghubir Singh Sahib Bahadur from India.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only provides a photo and a Burmese-language post without any additional evidence or sources to verify the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the photo is of Maharaja of Bundi, Maharao Raja Shri Sir Raghubir Singh Sahib Bahadur from India, as evidenced by the comparison with the AKG Image's photo and the information from the Rajasthan state government website.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the photo shows the very first Islam King of Rakhine State, without providing any substantial evidence to support this claim.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misidentifying the person in the photo as King Minhti when it is actually Maharaja of Bundi, Maharao Raja Shri Sir Raghubir Singh Sahib Bahadur from India.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photo is of King Minhti without providing sufficient evidence or sources to support this assumption.
